g:HTMLPanel.h1: Pledge to purchase your show, per episode direct from the producers!
g:HTMLPanel.p: We have all had a favorite show that was cancelled. Who cancelled it? The TV network executives. The network executives decide a show is too expensive, or too complicated so they cancel a show, or stop purchasing episodes. The TV networks goal is to air inexpensive shows to a large audience. That audience is not you! You like good, in-depth programming, with good acting and writing, so why not purchase (and view) episodes of your show directly from the producers?
g:HTMLPanel.h2: Save Your Show! How much would you pay per episode?
g:HTMLPanel.p: Why should the middle man determine what you can watch? The technology has existed for years now to purchase episodes of your show directly from the producers.
Your show was cancelled because the networks want a large cut of the profit to decide what you can watch.
This is an inefficient model. Why not pay for episodes directly? Eliminate the middle-man.
g:HTMLPanel.h2: How much would you pay per episode for a show?
g:HTMLPanel.p: ShowPledge is a petition of sorts. How do the producers of a show know if they can continue to make their show? We show them with your voting dollars. If enough people pledge to purchase episodes of a show, itâ€™s possible for the show to go on.
